com.veil.extendedscripts.extendedapi

Interface AbstractExtendedAPI


  • public interface AbstractExtendedAPI
    This object stores functions available to all scripting handlers through the "extAPI" keyword.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean attributeExists(java.lang.String key) 
      IEntity createIEntity(java.lang.String entityName, IWorld world)
      Creates an instance of an IEntity that can be spawned in the world with IWorld.spawnEntityInWorld(noppes.npcs.api.entity.IEntity)
      java.lang.String[] getAllServerPlayerNames() 
      IAttributeDefinition getAttributeDefinition(java.lang.String key) 
      java.lang.String[] getAttributeKeyList()
      Gets a list of all the custom attributes' keys currently registered in your world.
      java.lang.String[] getCustomAttributeKeyList()
      Gets a list of only the custom attributes' keys that do not come natively with CustomNpcs+.
      java.lang.String[] getEntityNameList()
      Gets an array of the names of the registered entities in the game.
      int hexToNpcColor(java.lang.String hex)
      Converts a hex code to an integer color that can be used for ScriptedItem's setColor IItemCustomizable.setColor(Integer) method.
      java.lang.String npcColorToHex(int npcColor)

      Registers a custom attribute that can both be applied via script or /kam attribute.

      Unregisters a custom attribute.
      void updatePlayerAttributes(EntityPlayer player)
      Player attributes are typically changed anytime you change what item you are holding.

    • Method Detail

      • getEntityNameList

        java.lang.String[] getEntityNameList()
        Gets an array of the names of the registered entities in the game. These names can be used in functions like createIEntity(String, IWorld).

      • createIEntity

        IEntity createIEntity(java.lang.String entityName,
                      IWorld world)
        Creates an instance of an IEntity that can be spawned in the world with IWorld.spawnEntityInWorld(noppes.npcs.api.entity.IEntity)
        Parameters:
        entityName - To see all valid names, call getEntityNameList()
        Returns:
        An IEntity or null if entityName is invalid

      • hexToNpcColor

        int hexToNpcColor(java.lang.String hex)
        Converts a hex code to an integer color that can be used for ScriptedItem's setColor IItemCustomizable.setColor(Integer) method.
        Parameters:
        hex - A length six hex code (#'s are removed automatically)
        Returns:
        An integer color or -1 if wrong length and -2 if string is not a hex code.

      • npcColorToHex

        java.lang.String npcColorToHex(int npcColor)

      • getAllServerPlayerNames

        java.lang.String[] getAllServerPlayerNames()

      • updatePlayerAttributes

        void updatePlayerAttributes(EntityPlayer player)
        Player attributes are typically changed anytime you change what item you are holding. They are also updated when core attributes are updated via command/script. Call this function if you need to manually update a player's attributes.

      • registerAttribute

        void registerAttribute(java.lang.String key,
                       java.lang.String displayName,
                       char colorCode,
                       int attributeType,
                       int section)
        Registers a custom attribute that can both be applied via script or /kam attribute. Attributes are registered per world.
        Parameters:
        key - This, by convention, is always lowercase and words are separated by _'s. This name is used within your scripts to denote your attribute.
        displayName - This name will show up on your item.
        colorCode - Takes one of Minecraft's 16 colors 0-9 and a-f. See IColorCodes.
        attributeType - 0. Flat, 1. Percent, 2. Magic. See IAttributeValueType
        section - 0. Base, 1. Modifier, 2. Stats, 3. Info, 4. Extra. The higher the number, the further down the section is. See IAttributeSection

      • unregisterAttribute

        boolean unregisterAttribute(java.lang.String key)
        Unregisters a custom attribute. Unregistering an attribute also removes it from all items.

      • attributeExists

        boolean attributeExists(java.lang.String key)

      • getAttributeKeyList

        java.lang.String[] getAttributeKeyList()
        Gets a list of all the custom attributes' keys currently registered in your world.

      • getCustomAttributeKeyList

        java.lang.String[] getCustomAttributeKeyList()
        Gets a list of only the custom attributes' keys that do not come natively with CustomNpcs+.

      • getAttributeDefinition

        IAttributeDefinition getAttributeDefinition(java.lang.String key)
